bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Commitment.

keywords.term: Western District of Washington, Northern Division
United Kingdom of Great Britian and Ireland

div1.p: O.H. LAMOREUX COURT STENOGRAPHER NOME, ALASKA
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION, BEFORE Hon. ROBERT W. McCLELLAND, Esq., COMMISSIONER OF THE UNITED STATES.
IN RE: THE EXTRADITION OF FLETCHER DECKER.

This cause having come on for hearing on the 24th and 25th days of August, 1921, upon the application of George H. L. Murray, for the extradition from the Northern Division of the Western District of Washington, tomthe Province of Saskatchewan, in the Dominion of Canada, one of the Dominions of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, ruled by His Majesty, George the V, its King, of one Fletcher Decker, and it appearing to the Court from the testimony introduced in said hearing that the said Fletcher Decker did, in the Province of Saskatchewan, in the Dominion of Canada aforesaid, on or about the 15th day of November, 1915, near Wiwa Post Office, the said Fletcher Decker then and there being, did then and there steal about three hundred bushes of flax, the property of Claude Ficklin, and was thereby guilty of theft, contrary to the Criminal Code of Canada, and that said crime in one of the crimes covered by the extradition convention between the United States of America and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, and proclaimed by the President of the United States of America on the 25th day of March 1890, supplementary to the Tenth Article of the Treaty concluded between the same high contracting parties on the 9th day of August, 1842.
C.H. LAMOREUX COURT STENOGRAPHER NOME, ALASKA

That heretofore, I have certified the foregoing facts, together with a copy of all the testimony taken before me to the Secretary of State that a warrant may issue upon the requisition of the proper authorities of the said Province of Saskatchewan in the Dominion of Canada.

NOW THEREFORE, the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, is hereby directed, and this is his warrant to commit thesaid Fletcher Decker to the King County Jail, there to remain until such surrender shall be made to the Province of Saskatchewan of the said Fletcher Decker.
Done in open Court this 26th day of August, 1921.
